folder: Central Park & The Pond. [Metropolitan Club; Sherry-Netherland Hotel.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, showing two of the Park's swans and the famous swanboat. The tall building in the center is the Hotel Pierre, with the small, white Metropolitan Club adjoining it. At the extreme right is a portion of the Sherry-Netherland Hotel.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A similar view from the far side of the Pond. Note the absence
of the Hotel Pierre in this scene.
May 30, 1909.
Walter L. Bogert.
(3)
A similar view in a westward direction, showing the twin towers of
the San Remo in the background.
August 4, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond. [Metropolitan Club; Sherry-Netherland Hotel.]

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY

1910
Mulferd Simonson Photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park, the Pond: the pedestrian bridge, looking west. Because of the dense foliage, Central Park West cannot be seen. In the foreground is a mother duck with her brood.
1923.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, with Central Park West apartment houses in the background.
Two wild ducks swim in the foreground; perhaps they are lineal
descendants of the babies shown in No. 1.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same. One of the swans may be seen under the arch of the
bridge.
May 1S, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: The Pool, on the west side, near 10lst Street, showing seven wild geese in the water.
This pool empties into the Loch, which in turn drains into Harlem Were.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

text:

Avenue apartment houses.
March 28, 1928.

(2)

June 8, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, with a flock of ducks in the foreground.
March 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) and (2)
Central Park: A set of 2 views showing a pedestrian bridge crossing a neck of the Pond. The photographer, viewing westward, shows
same in a wintery setting.
About 1930.
(3)
The same view in a summery garb. Buildings in the background are on Central Park West. Note the new apartment house to the left.
April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: A set of 3 views, northward, showing a portion of the Pond with rowboats gathered therein. Buildings shown,line the east side of Fifth Ave.; the eastern confine of this garden spot.
About 1930.

folder: Central Park & The Pond. Bergdorf-Goodman Department Store; Plaza Hotel; Savoy-Plaza Hotel; Sherry-Netherland Hotel., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, at the southeast corner of the Park. In the summer the Pond is a popular spot for boating; in the
winter, it is crowded with ice-skaters.
The buildings in the background are: the Plasa Hotel, at the extreme Iight; the Savoy-Plaza in the right centre; and the
Sherry-Netherland in the centre.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, looking southeast through the arch of the pedestrian bridge. The builcings in the background are: Plaza Hotel, at extreme right; the Scuibb Builcing, with the flag; the Savoy-Plaza in the centre; and the Sherry-Netherland on the
left.
May 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, taken from the bridge shown in No. 2. The buildings are the same, but between the Plaza and the Scuibb Building PVy be seen the Bergdorf-Goodman store, which replaced the
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond. Bergdorf-Goodman Department Store; Plaza Hotel; Savoy-Plaza Hotel; Sherry-Netherland Hotel.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: the Pond, showing a pair of the Park's swans. The disposition of these birds is notoriously bad.
May 15, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
May 15, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(3)
The same. The swans are separated by a boat.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Central Park & The Pond, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Central Park: the Pond, with three wild ducks in the foreground. The view is southeast towards Fifth Avenue, and the buildings from right to left are: the Squibb Building, the Savoy-Plaza, the Sherry-Netherland, the Ritz Tower, the Metropolitan Club (separated from the Sherry-Netherland by two small buildings) and the Hotel Pierre.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, but not showing the ducks, the Squibb Building,
nor the Savoy-Plaza.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3) The same, a closer view.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park : the Pond, looking northwest towards the Central Park
West apartments from the pedestrian bridge.
May 21, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: the Pond, showing the famous swanboat. Warm spring weather has brought out a crowd to enjoy an hour or so of boating.
In the background is the Plaza Hotel.
May 21, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: The Pond in the S.E. corner of the Park. This view is from the small pedestrian bridge and is in a southeastward direction to show the famous hotels located on the confines of this garden area. Shown from left to right are the Ritz Tower, the Sherry-Netherland and the Savoy-Plaza Hotels, and the Squibb Building (white, with flag thereon).
On the right is the famous Plaza Hotel.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
N9
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: a view southeastward across a corner of the Park, showing The Pond in the foreground with New York's major hotels for a background. This, a negative that has been reversed in the printing, shows from left to right, The Plaza Hotel; the General Electric Building; the Squibb Building; the Savoy-Plaza and the Sherry Netherland Hotels.
About 1936
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: Reflections in a corner of the Pond.
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad P.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: A corner of the Pond in winter. Note the bridge
in the background..
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad A.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: A corner of the Boat Lake (also known as the Pond) with
several ducks that habituate this area.
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park: Reflections in The Pond of New York's majestic hotel belt.
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park, The Pond: A view westward on the walk that skirts the southern edge of this body of water, located in the southeastern corner of the Park. Buildings appearing on the left are on Central Park South (West 59th Street). View No. 2 of this set shows a close up of the tame pelicans.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park, The Pond: A view westward on the walk that skirts the southern edge of this body of water, located in the southeastern corner of the Park. Buildings appearing on the left are on Central Park South (West 59th Street). View No. 2 of this set shows a close up of the tame pelicans.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.

folder: Central Park & The Pond., Manhattan, NY
text:
Central Park--The Pond: A girl feeding the swans.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTIONS

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Pond.
